intro: Campylospermum dependens var. amplexicaule, commonly known as the clinging campylospermum, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a shrub or small tree characterized by its opposite, ovate to elliptical leaves that often wrap around the stems, giving it a unique, clustered appearance. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne in the axils of the leaves. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in tropical botany and horticulture. The species is adapted to grow in a variety of soil types and can thrive in both full sun and partial shade.
